author: jgraafstra
body:
**Steps to reproduce**
upgraded from v6.0.0-alpha.11 to v6.0.0-alpha.12
Get-PackageProvider -ListAvailable -Debug -Verbose


**Expected behavior**
Should return list of available packages


**Actual behavior**
returns: VERBOSE: PowerShell meta provider initialization failed.


**Environment data**
----------------
Name                           Value                                                                                                                                                                                                
----                           -----                                                                                                                                                                                                
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha                                                                                                                                                                                          
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                                                                                                                                 
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                                                                                              
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0                                                                                                                                                                                              
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.12                                                                                                                                                                                      
CLRVersion                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
WSManStackVersion              3.0                                                                                                                                                                                                  
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                                                                                  
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1   


Additionally, running Get-Package returns the following:

`Get-Package : Unable to find package providers ().
At line:1 char:1
+ Get-Package -Debug -Verbose
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidArgument: (Microsoft.Power...lets.GetPackage:GetPackage) [Get-Package], Exception
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : UnknownProviders,Microsoft.PowerShell.PackageManagement.Cmdlets.GetPackage`

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I can't reproduce. 
@jgraafstra could you provide more details?

comments.author: jgraafstra
comments.body:
OS is: OS X 10.11.6 (El Capitan)

I was trying to pull down a new MySql package and was having an issue with it working. Something seemed off with the package manager. So, I ran `Get-Package` and noticed that there were no package providers / packages:

`Get-Package : Unable to find package providers ().
At line:1 char:1
- Get-Package
- ~~~~~~~~~~~
  - CategoryInfo          : InvalidArgument: (Microsoft.Power...lets.GetPackage:GetPackage) [Get-Package], Exception
  - FullyQualifiedErrorId : UnknownProviders,Microsoft.PowerShell.PackageManagement.Cmdlets.GetPackage`

Running `Get-PackageProvider` by itself returns nothing  -which is odd given that I'd previously installed Nuget.

Not sure if it helps but, I'm attaching a screenshot of the console. Let me know if you need more specific information on anything.
![issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22729131/20203687/5032f9ac-a77e-11e6-94e1-fe06c6d228a0.jpg)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @jgraafstra can you open an issue here: https://github.com/OneGet/oneget/issues

comments.author: zxcasd-zxcasd
comments.body: Note: this behavior is also seen immediately on 12 when deploying PS on a default installation of CentOS 7 (tried both Minimal and DVD). 12 DOES work, however, on Ubuntu.

comments.author: HemantMahawar
comments.body: This issue was moved to OneGet/oneget#244

comments.author: jgraafstra
comments.body: I added comments into the OneGet bug that was filed   -this issue appears to be resolved with version 6.0.13 of Powershell

title: PowerShell meta provider initialization failed
